thread.title: Emily Blunt Nixed Nude Scene in 'Sicario'
thread.title_full: Emily Blunt Nixed Nude Scene in 'Sicario'

author: AceShowbiz.com
title: Emily Blunt Nixed Nude Scene in 'Sicario'
text:
Comments Director Denis Villeneuve originally planned to include a nude scene featuring Blunt and Benicio Del Toro. 
Emily Blunt discussed a potential nude scene in her new movie " Sicario " during an interview with Howard Stern on his Sirius XM radio show. "[A nude scene] was in there originally but it came out because we didn't agree with it," Blunt explained. Howard, who's surprised by the thought of someone telling Blunt not to go naked, pressed her on who she meant by "we." John Krasinski 's wife responded with a laugh, saying, "My tits. [They said] 'we're not doing it.' " Blunt went on to say that Benicio Del Toro backed up her decision to have the racy scene canceled. "Benicio [Del Toro] backed me up," she said. "It was a scene between he and I." During the interview, Blunt was also asked about her past romance with ex Michael Buble . When asked about Buble's alleged infidelity during their relationship, the " Edge of Tomorrow " actress replied, "I don't know, it's complicated. I never want to talk about it. I can't do it." Blunt said she "had a good time" with Buble and that she still cares for the "Haven't Met You Yet" singer's family. "I loved his family," she shared, before clarifying, "I love his family. I still do." "Sicario" is scheduled to hit U.S. theaters on October 2. Blunt has two movies released in 2016 including " Animal Crackers " and " The Huntsman ".
